page.title: 02ARDMORE LODGE
page.content: At the centre of our rectangle is Ardmore Lodge, which belongs to Patrick Macrory who was knighted for his work in reorganising local government in Northern Ireland. The house was built by his great grandfather, Robert, in 1822, who founded the famous Macrory flour mills. The original building was a simple Ulster farmhouse, which was extended over the years. However, because of the lay of the land Robert could only build on at each end, resulting today in a house that is about 70 metres long but only one room wide. The thick walls of the first farmhouse are still obvious, as is the outline of the ladder stairway that led to the upstairs room. WRITTEN BY GREG (aged 11)
